Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2007 07:49PM patti_momof5 wrote: Thanks to all who have written to me.It makes a big difference when u can talk to someone who has been through it. I personally do not know anyone who has been so it is quite comforting to have you all.Can the radiologist give me valium or do i have to get some from my doctor?5 days and counting I will write again to let u all know how it went.This waiting until i have it done is awful.I am probably scaring myself more than anything.
Posts.Title: stereotactic biopsy patti_momof5 leaf

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2007 12:07PM patti_momof5 wrote: Thank you to everyone for their replies.I felt a lump a few weeks back and after the initial mammogram, they said i needed an ultrasound. The results were that the findings were "abnormal" and i needed to have it biopsied.They also found two spots on my left breast which they believe is just a benign growth so they will retest it in 6 months.Have never been through these tests before, i'm 36 now,and it's all a bit scary.
